messages.title: FAIRNESS
messages.content: What's the point of voting Labour if they won't stand up for FAIRNESS?

messages.title: FAIRER SOCIETY
messages.content: Only the Liberal Democrats are standing up for a FAIRER SOCIETY.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Give all children an equal start at school with policies like 'Every child from a poor home would get a £2,500 boost to their education.'
Lib Dem plans call for savings by cutting waste, like phone systems that few NHS Trusts use, to protect crucial public services.
Liberal Democrat reforms to target the rich and scrap tax for low earners, ensuring tax cuts for the poorest paid for by the super-rich.
The Liberal Democrats would not waste £25 billion replacing Trident nukes.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Only the Lib Dems can beat Labour here. Tactical situation highlighted with the statement 'It's so close here'.

issues.economy: Liberal Democrat economic plan would take the poorest out of tax altogether.
issues.education: Lib Dem policy to provide a £2,500 education boost for children from poor homes.
issues.health: Lib Dem plans to cut NHS waste to protect services.

endorsements.endorsement: Liberal Democrat reforms to target the rich and scrap tax for low earners.
Every child from a poor home would get a £2,500 boost to their education.

quotes.text: Labour tax the poorest not the super-rich.
The gap between rich and poor is wider under Labour.
Alistair Darling: we will cut deeper than Margaret Thatcher.

images.caption: Liberal Democrat leaflet detailing policies and criticisms of Labour.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet stresses the closeness of the Liberal Democrats to beating Labour in a specific, unnamed constituency and emphasizes various policy positions and criticisms of Labour policies and their effects on fairness and economy.
